The AWS CloudFormation template for this Serverless application

C:\\Users\\jatan\\OneDrive\\Desktop\\Lif.serviceRawFile:
service: lifebydorm-backend

useDotenv: true

provider:
  name: aws
  runtime: nodejs20.x
  region: us-east-1
  memorySize: 256
  timeout: 10
  environment:
    MONGODB_URI: ${env:MONGODB_URI}
    ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET: ${env:ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET}
    ADMIN_EMAILS: ${env:ADMIN_EMAILS, ''}
    FRONTEND_URL: ${env:FRONTEND_URL, ''}
    AWS_BUCKET_NAME: ${env:AWS_BUCKET_NAME}
    EMAIL_USER: ${env:EMAIL_USER}
    EMAIL_PASS: ${env:EMAIL_PASS}
    # AWS_REGION: ${env:AWS_REGION} # Reserved key, handled by provider.region
    NODE_ENV: production

  # Grant Lambda permission to access S3 properly using IAM roles
  # (This is better than hardcoding keys in env vars)
  iam:
    role:
      statements:
        - Effect: Allow
          Action:
            - s3:PutObject
            - s3:GetObject
            - s3:DeleteObject
          Resource: "arn:aws:s3:::${env:AWS_BUCKET_NAME}/*"

functions:
  api:
    handler: src/lambda.handler
    events:
      - http:
          path: /
          method: ANY
          cors: true
      - http:
          path: /{proxy+}
          method: ANY
          cors: true

build:
  esbuild:
    bundle: true
    minify: true
    sourcemap: false
    target: node20
    platform: node
    external:
      - aws-sdk

plugins:
  - serverless-offline

# custom:
#  esbuild configuration is now under build.esbuild
